Transformers¶

Below are a few custom scikit-learn transformers.

class jerml.transformers.Bettier(threshold=0.5)¶

Computes the Betti Numbers of the dark regions of a batch of images

threshold: float, optional

The transform method computes the Betti numbers of the region formed by any pixel darker than threshold.

transform(X, y=None)¶

Returns the betti numbers of the dark region of the images.

X: ndarray, shape (n_samples, n_x, n_y)

Batch of grayscale images.

Returns

X_transformed – Zeroeth and first Betti numbers of each image in the batch

Return type

ndarry, shape (n_samples, 2)

Bettier([threshold])

Computes the Betti Numbers of the dark regions of a batch of images

jerml.transformers.CumulantsExtractor([…])

Sci-kit learn transformer computing cumulants less than or equal to 4, or a specified highest cumulant.

jerml.transformers.GrayScaler()

Transforms a batch color images into a batch of grayscale images using 1-component PCA.

jerml.transformers.Reshaper(output_shape)

Reshapes a 2d array(e.g.
